original_title: Sri Lanka to get US$500mn World Bank budget support loan
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s cabinet has given the nod to sign an agreement to borrow a 500 million US dollar budget support loan from the World Bank, a statement said.
The loan would come in two tranches and is linked to structural benchmarks in an International Monetary Fund program.
The funds would come from World Bank’s concessionary International Development Association window.
The World Bank’s board is expected to approve the loan on June 28.
Sri Lanka is also due to get a 200 million dollar loans for its Aswesuma social safety net program. (Colombo/June27/2023)
